meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rancid.
meanings.sent1: The rancidities of the old oil made the whole kitchen smell bad.
meanings.sent2: The rancidities of the spoiled milk were evident as soon as you opened the carton.
meanings.sent3: The rancidities of the forgotten sandwich in his backpack surprised him during the class.
meanings.sent4: The rancidities of betrayal can linger longer than any physical odor.
meanings.sent5: The rancidities of the decaying fruit were a stark reminder of nature's cycle.

meanings.definition: A rancid or rotten smell or taste.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen was filled with the rancidities of the garbage that hadn't been taken out for days.
meanings.sent2: The rancidities of the spoiled meat were unmistakable even from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The rancidities of the old cheese made the cat turn away in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The rancidities of failure hung heavy in the air, suffocating any hope.
meanings.sent5: The rancidities of the swamp water assaulted our senses as we approached.
